case_name: Operators of stage carriages (Writ Petition Nos. 326 of 1972 and 203 of 1973 and Civil Appeals Nos. 1875, 1765 of 1972, 27, 361 of 1973)

facts.text: Writ Petition No. 326 of 1972 and 203 of 1973 filed under Article 32 of the Constitution of India for enforcement of fundamental rights.

anchor.surface_text: ORIGINAL JURISDICTION Writ Petition No. 326 of 1972 203 of 1973. Under Article 32 of the Constitution of India for the enforcement of fundamental rights.

facts.text: Civil Appeal No. 1875 of 1972 appealed by special leave from Kerala High Court judgment dated 15th March 1972 in P No. 23 of 1971.

anchor.surface_text: Civil Appeal No. 1875 of 1972. Appeal by Special Leave from the Judgment and Order dated the 15th March, 1972 of the Kerala High Court at Emakulam in P No. 23 of 1971.

facts.text: Civil Appeal No. 1765 of 1972 from Kerala High Court judgment dated 16th March 1972 in O.P. No. 3034 of 1971.

anchor.surface_text: Civil Appeal No. 1765 of 1972. From the Judgment and Order dated the 16th March,1972 of the Keral a High Court Ernakulam in O.P. No. 3034 of 1971.

facts.text: Petitioners in writ petitions and appellants in civil appeals are operators of stage carriages in the State of Kerala.

anchor.surface_text: The petitioners in the writ petitions and the appellants in Civil Appeals are operators of stage carriages in the, State of Kerala.

facts.text: Validity of Kerala Motor Vehicles Taxation of Passengers and Goods Amendment Act, 1970 (Act 18 of 1971) challenged.

anchor.surface_text: The validity of the Kerala Motor Vehicles  Taxation of Passengers and Goods Amendment  Act, 1970 for the sake of brevity called Act 18 of 1971 as well as the Motor Vehicles

facts.text: Validity of Motor Vehicles Kerala Third Amendment Act, 1971 (Act 34 of 1971) challenged.

anchor.surface_text: Kerala Third Amendment  Act, 1971 for the sake of brevity called Act 34 of 1971 is challenged.

facts.text: State of Kerala came into existence with effect from 1 November 1956.

anchor.surface_text: The State of Kerala came into existence with effect from 1 November 1956 by the, Reorganisation of States companyprising the Malabar area of the former Madras State

facts.text: Fare structure in Malabar area on 1 November 1956 was 3.90 nP per mile and minimum fare 31 nP for distances less than 8 miles.

anchor.surface_text: and the Travancore-Cochin area. The fare structure in force in the Malabar area as on 1 November, 1956 was 3.90 nP per mile and the minimum fare was 31 nP for distances less than 8 miles.

facts.text: Kerala Government on 15 April 1958 increased fare to 4 nP per mile and minimum fare to 16 nP.

anchor.surface_text: The, Kerala Government on 15 April, 1958 increased the rate of fare to 4 nP per mile and the minimum fare was 16 nP.

facts.text: Kerala Motor Vehicles Taxation of Passengers and Goods Act, 1963 (Act 25 of 1963) enacted.

anchor.surface_text: In 1963 the, Kerala Motor Vehicles  Taxation of Passengers and Goods Act, 1963 for the sake brevity called Act 25 of 1963 was ,enacted.

facts.text: Section 3 of Act 25 of 1963 levied tax of 10 nP in the rupee on fares and freights for passengers in stage carriages and 5 nP on freights for public carrier vehicles.

anchor.surface_text: Section 3 of Art 25 of 1963 provided that there shall be levied, and paid to the Government a tax on all passengers, luggage and goods carried by stage carriages and on all goods transported by public carrier vehicles at the rate of 10 nP in the rupee on the fares and freights payable to the operators of such stage carriages and at the rate of 5 nP in the rupee on the freights payable to the operators of such public carrier vehicles.

facts.text: Act 25 of 1963 published on 15 April 1963 and brought into force from 1 July 1963.

anchor.surface_text: The Act 25 of 1963 was published on 15 April, 1963 in the Kerala Gazette Extraordinary and was brought into force with effect from 1 July,. 1963.

facts.text: State Government published draft notification on 4 March 1963 for revising fare structure.

anchor.surface_text: The State Government of Kerala published a draft numberification on 4 March, 1963 for revising the fare structure.

facts.text: Final notification issued on 13 June 1963, published 18 June 1963, fixing fare at 3 nP per kilometre, minimum 20 nP.

anchor.surface_text: After hearing the representations and objections of the operators and the public, the final numberification was issued on 13 June, 1963 and was published in the Gazette on 18 June, 1963. By this numberification, the fare was fixed at 3 nP per kilometre and the minimum fare was fixed at 20 nP.

facts.text: Kerala High Court in Thomman Ors v. Regional Transport Officer (ILR 1968 2 Kerala 153) on 4 March 1968 held tax under Act 25 of 1963 is on passengers and goods but lacked satisfactory collection provision.

anchor.surface_text: The decision of-the Kerala High Court in Thomman Ors v. The Regional Transport Officer, Ernakulam 1  reported in I.L.R.  1968  2 Kerala 153 was on 4 March, 1968. The High Court held that the tax is a tax on the passengers and goods.

facts.text: Operators paid taxes under Act 25 of 1963 from 1963 to 1966 and collected tax on passengers and goods.

anchor.surface_text: From the year 1963 to 1966, the operators paid to the Government taxes under Act 25 of 1963. The operators companylected tax on passengers and goods.

facts.text: Notification dated 29 April 1968 published 30 April 1968 stated fare from 1 July 1963 inclusive of tax under Act 25 of 1963.

anchor.surface_text: Soon after the decision in Thomman case  supra  the State Government issued a numberification dated 29 April, 1968 and published it on 30 April, 1968. This numberification was to the effect number the fare with effect from 1 July, 1963 was inclusive of the tax leviable under Act 25 of 1963.

facts.text: Act 18 of 1971 passed by Legislature on 28 February 1970, assent of Governor on 1 June 1971.

anchor.surface_text: The impugned Act 18 of 1971 was passed by the Legislature on 28 February, 1970 and received the assent of the Governor on 1 June, 1971.

facts.text: Act 18 of 1971 amended section 3 of Act 25 of 1963 to clarify levy and collection of tax from passengers/consignors by operators.

anchor.surface_text: Act 18 of 1971 introduced two sub-sections to section 3 of the Act 25 of 1963. ... The tax levied under subsection  1  shall be paid by the passengers or the companysignors of the goods as the case may be to the operators along with the fares or freights payable to the operators

facts.text: Act 18 of 1971 contains validating section deeming all taxes levied or collected under Act 25 of 1963 before commencement as per amended section 3.

anchor.surface_text: Notwithstanding any judgment, decree or order of any companyrt, all taxes levied or companylected or purposed to have been levied or companylected under the Principal Act before the date of companymencement of this section shall be deemed to be and to have always been levied or companylected in accordance with law

facts.text: Act 34 of 1971 amended section 43 of Motor Vehicles Act 1939 adding sub-section 1A allowing fares inclusive of tax retrospectively.

anchor.surface_text: Act 34 of 1971 effected two principal changes. First, it amended section 43 of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1939 by adding sub-section  1A  to section 43 of that Act.

facts.text: Operators contend Acts 18 and 34 of 1971 levy tax on income of operators, not passengers/goods.

anchor.surface_text: The three principal companytentions on behalf of the operators with regard to the legality of Acts 18 and 34 of 1971 are these. First, the impugned provisions amount to a tax dot on passengers and goods but on the income of operators.

facts.text: Court holds tax under Act 25 of 1963 and amendments is on passengers and goods, not operators' income.

anchor.surface_text: The question whether the statutes, viz., Act 25 of 1963 and Act 18 of 1971 impose a tax on passengers and owners of goods or is a tax on the income of operators has been rightly held by the Kerala High Court ... to be a tax on passengers and goods.

facts.text: Fare fixed on 1 July 1963 included element of tax under Act 25 of 1963 as per contemporaneous evidence.

anchor.surface_text: The companytemporaneous evidence on the question whether the State Authorities at the time of fixing the fare in the month of July, 1963 included the tax imposed under Act, 25 of 1963 within the fare fixed

facts.text: Operators collected tax along with fare from passengers from 1 July 1963.

anchor.surface_text: The operators in companylecting fare from passengers in fact companylected the tax due from passengers under Act 25 of 1963 along with the fare.

facts.text: Petitions and appeals dismissed, Kerala High Court decisions upheld.

anchor.surface_text: The petitions,and appeals are dismissed. The decision of the Kerala High Court in Civil appeal No. 1875 of 1972 and other appeals is upheld.

holdings.text: The statutes, viz., Act 25 of 1963 and Act 18 of 1971 impose a tax on passengers and owners of goods, not on the income of operators.
holdings.reasoning_summary: Textual reading of levy provisions, agreement with Kerala High Court in Thomman case, application of Sainik Motors precedent holding incidence on passengers/goods with operators as collecting agents, competence under Entry 56 State List.

holdings.text: Tax under Act 25 of 1963 was included as an element in the fare fixed with effect from 1 July 1963.

anchor.surface_text: The contemporaneous evidence on the question whether the State Authorities at the time of fixing the fare in the month of July, 1963 included the tax imposed under Act, 25 of 1963 within the fare fixed is furnished first by the letter of the Director of Transport dated 2 April, 1963...

holdings.reasoning_summary: Contemporaneous documents including Director of Transport letter, operators' representations acknowledging tax element, Secretariat hearing notes calculating additional income against tax burden show tax factored into fare revision.

holdings.text: Operators collected tax due from passengers under Act 25 of 1963 along with the fare.

anchor.surface_text: The operators in collecting fare from passengers in fact collected the tax due from passengers under Act 25 of 1963 along with the fare.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Factual finding from practice since 1963-1966 payments, continued post-1971, integrated with fare collection mechanism at 10 np/rupee rate.

holdings.text: Retrospective validation of levy and collection of taxes by Act 18 of 1971 is legal.

anchor.surface_text: Notwithstanding any judgment, decree or order of any court, all taxes levied or collected or purported to have been levied or collected under the Principal Act before the date of commencement of this section shall be deemed to be and to have always been levied or collected in accordance with law

holdings.reasoning_summary: Validation deems past actions lawful as section 3 amended was factually in effect via fare inclusion and collections; no new liability created; factual basis exists unlike unreasonable cases; distinguishes Rai Ramkrishna as character unchanged.

holdings.text: Legislature competent to amend section 43 of Motor Vehicles Act 1939 by Act 34 of 1971 to retrospectively include tax within fare; no new tax or character alteration.
holdings.reasoning_summary: Act 34 clarifies retrospective inclusion matching 1963 facts; s.43 empowers fare directions inclusive of tax; follows Srikantiah precedent on notifications incorporating tax in permits; no new levy, machinery explicit.

precedents.citation: Thomman Ors v. The Regional Transport Officer, Ernakulam 1 reported in I.L.R. 1968 2 Kerala 153

anchor.surface_text: The decision of-the Kerala High Court in Thomman Ors v. The Regional Transport Officer, Ernakulam 1 reported in I.L.R. 1968 2 Kerala 153 was on 4 March, 1968. The High Court held that the tax is a tax on the passengers and goods.

precedents.case_name: Thomman v. Regional Transport Officer, Ernakulam
precedents.cited_proposition: Act 25 of 1963 imposes tax on passengers and goods, not on operators; lacks satisfactory provision for collection of tax from passengers
precedents.cited_holding: the tax is a tax on the passengers and goods. The High Court expressed the view that there was no satisfactory provision for the collection of the tax.

precedents.citation: M s Sainik Motors, Jodhpur Others v The State of Rajasthan 1962 1 S.C.R. 517

anchor.surface_text: This Court in M s Sainik Motors, Jodhpur Others v The State of Rajasthan 1962 1 S.C.R. 517 construed the Rajasthan Passengers and Goods Taxation Act, 1959 and held that the incidence of the tax was upon passengers and goods and not upon the-income of the operators

precedents.case_name: Sainik Motors, Jodhpur v. State of Rajasthan
precedents.cited_proposition: Incidence of tax on passengers and goods carried by stage carriages is on passengers and goods, not on income of operators, though measured by fares and freights
precedents.cited_holding: the incidence of the tax was upon passengers and goods and not upon the-income of the operators of stage carriages though the measure of the tax is furnished by the amount of fare and freight charged

precedents.citation: Rai Ramkrishna Others v. The State of Bihar, 1964 1 SCR 897

anchor.surface_text: Reliance was placed on the decision of this Court in Rai Ramkrishna Others v. The State of Bihar, 1964 1 SCR 897 in support of the contention that the character of the tax was, altered by its retrospective operation.

precedents.case_name: Rai Ramkrishna v. State of Bihar
precedents.cited_proposition: Retrospective validation of tax on passengers and goods does not alter character of tax if scheme valid prospectively
precedents.cited_holding: tax recovered retrospectively like the one which will be recovered prospectively still continues to be a tax on passengers and it, adopts the same machinery for the recovery of the tax both as to the past as well as to the future

precedents.citation: S. Srikantiah Ors. v The Regional Transport AuthoritY. Anantapur Ors. 1971 Suppl C.R. 816

anchor.surface_text: In the recent decision in S. Srikantiah Ors. v The Regional Transport AuthoritY. Anantapur Ors. 1971 Suppl C.R. 816 this Court considered the validity of a notification under section 43 of the Motor vehicles Act, 1939.

precedents.case_name: S. Srikantiah v. Regional Transport Authority, Anantapur
precedents.cited_proposition: Notification under section 43 fixing maximum fares inclusive of tax incorporates the fare including tax as condition of permit; legislature competent to allow directions on fares inclusive of tax
precedents.cited_holding: the notification under the Motor Vehicles Act in that case issued under section 43 of the Act fixing the maximum fare inclusive of the tax leviable as a condition of the permit
